conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with an ideal gas undergoing a cyclic process ABCDA on a P-V diagram.
The diagram is a rectangle on a P-V diagram, indicating isobaric and isochoric processes.
Labeling the processes: A to B is isochoric, B to C is isobaric, C to D is isochoric, D to A is isobaric.
Using the ideal gas law PV = nRT, where n is constant throughout the cycle.
Considering the isochoric process from A to B, P ‚àù T, leading to P1/T0 = P2/TB.
Solving for TB gives TB = (P2 / P1) * T0.
Using the ideal gas law at points A and B to verify TB = (P2 / P1) * T0.
Considering work done or heat exchanged in an isochoric process, but lacking specific heat capacity information.
Reviewing the entire cycle to ensure consistency with the initial temperature T0.
Reaffirming TB = (P2 / P1) * T0 and checking units for consistency.
Verifying the result with an example.
